names.hanzi: ease of decoction of eight ingredients
names.commonEnglish: Ease of Decoction of Eight Ingredients

actions: Expels Wind-Dampness, alleviates pain, dispels Internal Wind and stops spasms.
With Jing Jie, for Wind-Cold.
With Cang Zhu, for pain due to Wind-Dampness Bi with aching joints, heavy limbs and generalized aching discomfort.
Releases the Exterior, expels Wind, Dispels Internal Wind and relieves muscle spasms.
With Dang Gui and Chuan Xiong, for itching and tremors of the hands and feet from Wind due to Blood Deficiency.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi, expels Wind and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
with Fang Feng and Jing Jie, for headaches due Wind-Cold Invasion.
Moderates spasms, alleviates pain, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Invigorates and harmonizes the Blood and disperses Cold.
With Chuan Xiong, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Induces sweating, expels Wind-Dampness and clears Dampness from the Lower Jiao.
Warms the Middle Jiao, disperses Cold, dispels Dampness and alleviates pain.
Disperses Wind, clears Heat and dries Dampness.
Drains Damp-Heat especially from the Lower Jiao.
With Cang Zhu, eliminates Dampness and clears Heat for Lower Jiao Damp-Heat with pain, swelling, and weakness in the lower limbs and regulates painful obstruction in the legs and knees.
Promotes the circulation of Qi and Blood
Eliminates Blood Stasis
Unblocks the channels and collaterals
Alleviates pain

symptoms: Fixed pain with swelling in the toe(s)
Pain worse with pressure and movement
A history of trauma to the toe(s)

notes: The toes may also be soaked in the decoction once daily.
